newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Foreign investment in Morocco to reach $1.0 bln/97.
newsitem.headline: Foreign investment in Morocco to reach $1.0 bln/97.

text.p: Moroccan Finance Minister Mohamed Kabbaj on Friday said the country is expected to drain at least $1.0 billion foreign investments by end 1997 from an average annual $500 million, the official news agency MAP reported.
Quoting Kabbaj as saying, MAP said: "Morocco has created a framework favouring foreign investments through a new trade, an active privatisation programme and other financial tools".

Kabbaj was addressing a two-day seminar on investments in Africa, co-hosted by Morocco and the United Nations Conference for Trade and Development, held in the central city of Fez and attended by about 100 countries, MAP said.

African countries "had to take a common stand" to attract more direct private investments which remain extremely modest at around $4.5 billion per year for the whole continent or less than 1.5 percent of overall international investments.
